medical_history.chief_complaint: Chest-wall mass and large pleural effusion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in her usual state of health until approximately 6.5 weeks before admission. During this time, her mother noted recurrent blood-tinged sputum in the tracheostomy tube and an episode of bleeding at the tracheostomy site occurred at school. In the 2 weeks prior to admission, oxygen saturation fell to approximately 85%, and a day before admission, chest asymmetry and prominent blood vessels were observed. The patient reported discomfort in her chest while being hugged.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of long-term tracheostomy due to airway stenosis from a caustic injury in infancy; sleep apnea; history of dental caries necessitating extraction of several deciduous teeth.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with adoptive parents and siblings, physically active, two dogs and a cat at home; mother smokes outside; no recent travel or contact with ill persons.
